info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 1:39AM CDT until June 29 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Dakota, including the following county, Deuel.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 7 inches are estimated to have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected through the overnight hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clear Lake, Gary, Altamont, Bemis, Lake Alice and Moritz. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
